definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: As Voldemort, defeat Harry Potter in Duelling Club.
sentences.chinese: 在決鬥俱樂部中以伏地魔戰勝哈利波特。

sentences.english: Tom Riddle hides his snake inside. His ginormous secret chamber.
sentences.chinese: 伏地魔藏有一條蛇怪在他的密室之中。

sentences.english: Voldemort is also an accomplished Legilimens.
sentences.chinese: 伏地魔也是一個高超的攝神取念者。

sentences.english: Since Voldemort refused to acknowledge Harry as significant, he underestimated Harry's intelligence and strenth. We all know what happened in the end.
sentences.chinese: 由於伏地魔輕視哈利波特，最後的結局大家都知道了。

sentences.english: Lord Voldemort is preparing for battle and so must Harry.
sentences.chinese: 伏地魔和哈利都嚴正以待，準備戰鬥。

sentences.english: Since Voldemort refused to acknowledge Harry as significant, he underestimated Harry’s intelligence and strenth. We all know what happened in the end.
sentences.chinese: 由於伏地魔輕視哈利波特，最後的結局大家都知道了。

sentences.english: The huge snake emerged to climb slowly up Voldemort's chair.
sentences.chinese: 一條巨蛇緩緩地爬上伏地魔的椅子。

sentences.english: Taxonomy and phytogeography of Chiogenes Salisbury.
sentences.chinese: 伏地杜鵑屬的分類與分佈。

sentences.english: When it comes to the chest, you can't go wrong with the push-ups.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要練胸肌，多作些伏地挺身就絕不會錯了。

sentences.english: Tom Marvolo Riddle:Voldemort is my past, present and future.
sentences.chinese: 伏地魔就是我的過去，現在，還有未來。

sentences.english: At that moment he felt that nobody mattered but Voldemort.
sentences.chinese: 在這一刻，他覺得除了伏地魔，別人都不再重要。

sentences.english: Split your soul. Seven parts of a whole. They're horcruxes.
sentences.chinese: 伏地魔的靈魂被魂器分開，一共有七個部分。

sentences.english: Use only Protego during a duel in the Duelling Club.
sentences.chinese: 在決鬥俱樂部中以伏地魔戰勝哈利波特。

sentences.english: Do not forget that Lord Voldemort believes that he alone knows about his Horcruxes.
sentences.chinese: 你別忘了，伏地魔相信只有他一個人知道他的魂器。

sentences.english: I can do 100 push-ups in a row.
sentences.chinese: 我可以一次做100個伏地挺身。

definition: to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
